Winston Churchill’s tribute ‘Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few’, was paid to which of the UK’s armed forces? | Royal Air Force
Winter, Hail, Ice and Frost all appear in which ballet? | The Seasons
With Teeth and Year Zero were hit albums in the 2000s by which band? | Nine Inch Nails
With the invention of the proscenium stage, on how many sides of the theatre were the audience seated? | Three
With which athletics field event is Jan Zelezny associated? | Javelin
With which band is Adam Levine the lead singer? | Maroon 5
With which other airline did Continental merge to form United? | United Airlines
With which song did Swedish pop group Abba win the 1974 Eurovision Song Contest? | Waterloo
With whom did Ashanti have a 2002 No.1 single? | Ja Rule
With whom did Faith Evans had a No. 1 hit in 1997 with the song “I’ll Be Missing You”? | Puff Daddy
With whom is Sebastian a couple in Twelfth Night? | Olivia
Wizz Air is a low-cost airline with headquarters in which European country? | Hungary
WLG is the Airport Code for the Capital City of where? | New Zealand
Wolf Mankowitz wrote the 1953 novel ‘A Kid For Two….’what’? | Farthings
Women competed in the 3,000 metre steeplechase for the first time in the Summer Olympics in which year? | 2008
Women were not allowed to dance in public until which century (in ballet)? | 17th
Woodford Airport is in which English city? | Manchester
Woodford airport is located near which British city? | Manchester
Wootten and Belpaire are types of ‘what’ found in steam locomotives? | Firebox
 ‘World in ‘what’ was a UK current affairs television programme which ran from 1963 to 1998? | Action
World Science Day for Peace and Development was held during which month in 2011? | November – 10th
Worn as part of Highland dress, what is a skean-dhu? | Dagger/knife
 ‘Wot a lot I got’ was the advertising slogan for which confectionery items? | Smarties
Wrestler Dwayne Johnson, who appeared in the 2005 film ‘Doom’, is better known by what name? | The Rock
Wrigley Field in Chicago USA is a venue for which sport? | Baseball
Writer, poet and cartoonist Theodor Geisel is better known by what name for writing children’s books? | Dr Seuss
Wyclef Jean and Lauryn Hill were members of which 1990s group? | The Fugees
Wyneb is Welsh for which part of the body? | Face
Xanthic relates to which colour? | Yellow
Xanthophobia is the irrational fear of which colour? | Yellow
Xcaret is a holiday resort in which country? | Mexico
Xena was the informal name originally used for which body? | Eris
Xenia Onatopp, played by Famke Janssen, is the villain in which James Bond film? | Goldeneye
Xerasia is an excessive dryness of which part of the body? | Hair
Xerophagy is the eating of what? | Dry food
X Type, Open End, Two Way and Closed End are all types of what used in the fashion industry? | Zip
Xuan (or Shuen) paper is commonly known by what name? | Rice paper
Xylography is the art of engraving on which natural substance? | Wood
Xylology is the study of which natural substance? | Wood
Xyrophobia is the irrational fear of which grooming items? | Razors
Yang Yong-eun, the first Asian winner of a golf major in 2009 is from which nation? | South Korea
Yankee Stadium is located in which borough of New York City? | The Bronx
Yeager Airport is located in which American State? | West Virginia
Yellow-pine, Uinta and Lodgepole are all types of which animal? | Chipmunk
Yellowstone National Park is located primarily in which US state? | Wyoming
Yeux is French for which part of the body? | Eyes
YMCA stands for which worldwide organisation? | Young Men’s Christian Association
Yoff Airport can be found in which African country? | Senegal
Yorick’s skull appears in which play by William Shakespeare? | Hamlet
You Belong With Me was a 2009 hit for which singer? | Taylor Swift
Young Cate appears in which Shakespeare play? | Julius Caesar
 ‘You’re doing fine’ is the call for which Bingo number? | 29
Yundam Airport is located in which African country? | Gambia
Yuval Steinitz became Minister for Finance of which country in March 2009? | Israel
YWCA stand for which Worldwide organisation? | Young Women’s Christian Association
YXY is the Airport code for the airport in which Canadian City? | Whitehorse
YYC is the code for an Aiport in which Canadian City? | Calgary
YYZ is the official airport code for the airport in which city? | Toronto
YZF is the code for an Airport in which Canadian City? | Yellow Knife
Zagreb is the capital of which European country? | Croatia
Zakumi was the name of the official mascot for which sporting competition? | 2010 FIFA World Cup

Zia is an airport located in which country? | Bangladesh
Zimt is German for which spice? | Cinnamon
Zine El Abidine Ben Ali became President of which African country in November 1987? | Tunisia

Zorro is Spanish for which animal? | Fox
Zucchini is another name for which vegetable? | Courgette
